Description: Blue glazed composition shabti of Padiamun or Padiamennebnesuttawy with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with ears and a beard and large joined hands in relief; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the foot; the figure is broken into two pieces at the ankle.
Condition: broken into two pieces at ankle level
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (perhaps)
